description: A dark, gloomy island with dense forests, persistent fog, and an overcast sky. The island features ruins of the ancient Shikkearu Kingdom, with a central castle built partially over a small lake. Its distinctive curved hills resemble those from Tim Burton's 'The Nightmare Before Christmas'.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Arrives on Kuraigana Island
keyEvents.description: Zoro wakes up on Kuraigana Island after being sent there by Bartholomew Kuma.
keyEvents.significance: First appearance of the island that becomes Zoro's training ground.

keyEvents.title: Perona Revealed on the Island
keyEvents.description: Perona is shown to have also been sent to Kuraigana Island by Kuma.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes that both Zoro and Perona are stranded on the same island.

culturalSignificance: Former site of the Shikkearu Kingdom, now in ruins. The island is inhabited by Humandrills, intelligent ape-like creatures that learned to fight with weapons by watching a terrible war.

geography.climate: Dark and gloomy with persistent fog and overcast skies
geography.terrain: Dense forests, ruined structures, curved hills, central castle over a lake
notableFeatures: Central castle partially built over a lake

trivia: The island's design was inspired by Tim Burton's 'The Nightmare Before Christmas'
Humandrills learned to fight by watching a war that occurred on the island nine years before the current story
Mihawk and Perona later revitalized the island through farming, turning the violent Humandrills into peaceful farmhands

description: An impoverished island also known as Harahettania, the 'Land of Poverty'. The island is terrorized by the Longarm Tribe and its desperate inhabitants resort to occult rituals to summon help.

keyEvents.title: Brook Arrives on Namakura Island
keyEvents.description: Brook lands on Namakura Island after being sent there by Bartholomew Kuma, coincidentally appearing in a demonic summoning circle.
keyEvents.significance: First appearance of Namakura Island and setup for Brook's storyline.

keyEvents.title: Brook Mistaken for Satan
keyEvents.description: The villagers believe they successfully summoned Satan when Brook appears in their summoning circle.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the desperation of the villagers and Brook's role as their protector.

culturalSignificance: Known as the 'Land of Poverty', the island represents extreme hardship and desperation. The villagers' attempt to summon Satan shows how far they've been pushed by the Longarm Tribe's raids.

notableFeatures: Demonic summoning circles used by desperate villagers
Village under constant threat from Longarm Tribe

trivia: Also known as Harahettania, which translates to 'Land of Poverty'
The villagers practice occult rituals in their desperation for help against the Longarm Tribe
